The expert: s involvement and role in the 2006 referendum that banned same-sex marriage in Wisconsin.
The results of the 2006 referendum: where 59 percent of voters endorsed the definition of marriage as between one man and one woman.
Reference to polls and surveys: including a Wisconsin statewide poll conducted by St. Norbert College in 2014, which found a slim majority in favor of the 2006 amendment's language regarding marriage for one man and one woman, but also documented relatively large changes in opinion.
